page.title: 15THE PIER- SW.BOGNOR REGIS
page.content: {The Pier}was built in{1863-65}at a cost of{Â£5000.}It was then{305 metres long. The extension and the{Pavilion at the end of the Pier were both opened in{1900.}The{landing stage}for paddle steamers was added in{1903.}In 1908 the Pier was sold to The Bognor Pier company for 10/6 (52.5p).It was widened in{1910-11} so that people could reach the end of the Pier without passing through the theatre. The Pier became its present length because of a storm in{1965}which caused the sea-end to break off.The pier was repainted in{1976.}Now in {1985 }there are different facilities available on the Pier.There is a new {night club}called "Sheik's" in the old theatre,there is also a{Kiddies' fun {fair,}an{amusement arcade}and a {cafeteria.}It is also possible to{fish off the Pier at a cost of 50p.
